subject: Fix kolla_set_configs --check with a directory
commit_message:
Fix kolla_set_configs --check with a directory

There are several issues with kolla_set_configs --check:

1. We calculate the destination path incorrectly when comparing a file
   in a directory, due to passing arguments to os.path.relpath in the
   wrong order
2. For directories that have not changed, we also attempt to compare
   them as files, which fails when they are open()ed.
3. If the config JSON does not have a config_files key, it fails with a
   KeyError.

The first two issues affect the fluentd container, which specifies
directories as the source, without using a glob. The third affects OVN
containers.

This patch fixes these issues.

Closes-Bug: #1890567

subject: Avoid reboot for node update even when kernelargs changed
commit_message:
Avoid reboot for node update even when kernelargs changed

During update/upgrade/scale, already deployed node should
not be rebooted, if the kernel args are changed. Reboot of
the node should be planned by the user with migration and
downtime window. With this change, the kernel args will be
updated to the already deployed node, but it will not be
applied with reboot. For fresh nodes, where kernel args
entry is not found, the reboot will be applied.

In case, when the existing node is deployed without kernel
args but during an update the kernel args are added. At this
time a reboot is required, because there are other services
which depends on the kernel args like hugepages for OvS-DPDK
and iommu for SR-IOV.

It leaves with another edge case, when the node is deployed
with only SR-IOV and OvS-DPDK is added later or vice-versa,
the node will not be rebooted. As such kind of deployments
require network config changes, it requires more planning.
This scenario has to be handled on case-by-case basis.
Closes-Bug: #1895105

subject: libvirt: Don't age swap files in the image cache
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't age swap files in the image cache

Bug 1804262 revealed that the bdm query executed by the image cache
periodic task in _list_running_instances can be prohibitively
expensive on large deployments using shared storage. The only purpose
of this query is to populate used_swap_images, which is in turn used
by the libvirt driver's image cache to age the backing files of swap
disks.

This change removes this query, and the aging of swap disks.

In justification, firstly note that there is no good reason to store
swap disk backing files in the image cache. The motivation appears to
be to avoid running mkswap for each instance provisioned with a swap
disk, but mkswap is both very fast and uses very little disk space:

  $ truncate -s 256G swap.img

  $ time mkswap swap.img
  mkswap: swap.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 256 GiB (274877902848 bytes)
  no label, UUID=7264593e-33aa-4e15-8bf3-65e65ee3504c

  real    0m0.006s
  user    0m0.001s
  sys     0m0.002s

  $ du -sh swap.img
  4.0K    swap.img

The other problem with having backing files for swap disks is that
they are generated locally to each compute host, but are not
identical:

  $ for i in 1 2; do truncate -s 1G swap$i.img; mkswap swap$i.img; done
  mkswap: swap1.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=98d0d2f0-8f84-4eb8-b3ab-c15deda1dd04
  mkswap: swap2.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=f7eddffa-9f44-4bbf-87bf-abdb2bb3d2c8

  $ md5sum swap?.img
  178b3b5e38c37d6b4474b013be001475  swap1.img
  6cd14d0bcfb5fae6c924e13fcbf58ae6  swap2.img

The problem with this is that if we migrate (cold or live) an
instance, we will use the same overlay file for the swap disk with the
host-local, and therefore different, backing file. In practise the
chances of this resulting in data corruption are low, but it is not a
good idea, and we shouldn't do it.

TL;DR The best solution here is to stop storing swap files in the
image cache, and provision a new one every time. That unfortunately
requires invasive changes to the libvirt driver.

Secondly, note that swap disk backing files are provisioned based on
size. Unlike glance images, which is the primary purpose of the image
cache, the number of different swap sizes in use across a deployment
is unlikely to grow significantly over time, so the cost of not aging
them is low.

Lastly, note that although we age backing files for swap disks, we
don't age them for ephemeral disks. For the same reasons as swap
disks, we should also not store backing files for ephemeral disks in
the image cache.

tests: Add reproducer for bug #1879878

When one resizes a pinned instance, the instance claims host CPUs for
pinning purposes on the destination. However, the host CPUs on the
source are not immediately relinquished. Rather, they are held by the
migration record, to handle the event that the resize is reverted. It is
only when one confirms this resize that the old cores are finally
relinquished.

It appears there is a potential race between the resource tracker's
periodic task and the freeing of these resources, resulting in attempts
to unpin host cores that have already been unpinned. This test
highlights that bug pending a fix.

subject: Fix kolla_set_configs --check with a directory
commit_message:
Fix kolla_set_configs --check with a directory

There are several issues with kolla_set_configs --check:

1. We calculate the destination path incorrectly when comparing a file
   in a directory, due to passing arguments to os.path.relpath in the
   wrong order
2. For directories that have not changed, we also attempt to compare
   them as files, which fails when they are open()ed.
3. If the config JSON does not have a config_files key, it fails with a
   KeyError.

The first two issues affect the fluentd container, which specifies
directories as the source, without using a glob. The third affects OVN
containers.

This patch fixes these issues.

Closes-Bug: #1890567

Change-Id: I8921befe51da4282121443849177a7ca5ebe8822
